TopicTitle: Throttle controls don't work in docking mode

Articles.Content:
EDIT: This now works in .25

I guess they made it so that "state = any" works. I assume you can change any to rotation or translation to stop throttle control in the opposite mode. Either way, I now have throttle pos control in staging, and incremental in docking mode.

I've tried remapping the trottle up/down for both keyboard and controller buttons and both the raw and increment axis for my controller, but the throttle goes to 0 and stays there no matter what i press. Checking the option to use staging controls in docking screws up the pitch/roll/yaw/translation controls.

Thanks in advance

works in .25
The only times I've run into something similar I found I accidentally had the time compression on. However, if you are trying to dock, I'd think that the apparent fast speeds would give that away.

Ya, this is on the pad, no time warp, rotation or translation mode. I even cleared the up/down translation keys and bound left shift and control to throttle to no avail. It's like the docking specific throttle key bindings are simply being ignored.

Which is just silly.
I've even tried messing with the binding's switchstate (which was defaulted to 'none') and group number. Nothin.
If you are in docking mode The Throttle doesn't function at all. If you are trying to dock and want throttle control you can use IJKLHN for translation while simultaneously using QWEASD for rotation.
:/ then why have docking_throttleup and such in the settings.cfg at all?

:/ then why have docking_throttleup and such in the settings.cfg at all?

This refers to translating up and down, if you hit your throttle up while in docking mode it moves your craft laterally upwards, the same goes for down.
I get that, but there are literally nodes for docking_throttleup, and docking_throttledown that you can set whatever other keys for, yet do nothing.
